content: Who won the Best Actor Oscar in 1994 for his role as an endearing simpleton in the film "Forrest Gump"?

In 1994, the Best Actor Oscar was won by Tom Hanks for his role as Forrest Gump in the film of the same name. His portrayal of the endearing and intellectually challenged protagonist earned him widespread acclaim and solidified his status as one of Hollywood's leading actors. The film itself was a massive success, both critically and commercially, and went on to win multiple Oscars, including Best Picture. Hanks' performance was particularly praised for its ability to convey depth and emotion through subtle nuances, making Forrest a beloved character in cinematic history.
